alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 8:11PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...Mendenhall Lake is Rising... Mendenhall Lake continues to rise this evening. Here is what we know. Lake levels were steady around 7 ft, but began to rise around 5 AM AKDT Sunday morning and are now approaching 8 ft. Latest webcam image from Suicide Basin indicates that the basin is still rising. This tells us that the most likely reason for the rising lake level is due to runoff from heavy rainfall as well as increased upper elevation ice melt. With limited data to work with, initial estimates suggest that the lake will continue to rise just above 8 ft before lowering back below 8 ft early Monday morning. Continue to monitor www.weather.gov/juneau for any additional updates.
